name: Node.js
author: contact@velrix.net
description: A runtime that brings JavaScript to the server, great for building fast, event-driven applications and APIs with a huge ecosystem.
startup: if [[ -d .git ]] && [[ {{AUTO_UPDATE}} == "1" ]]; then git pull; fi; if [[ "{{REINSTALL_PACKAGES}}" == "1" ]] && [ -f /home/container/package.json ]; then /usr/local/bin/npm install; fi; if [[ {{APP_FILE}} == *.js ]]; then /usr/local/bin/node "/home/container/${APP_FILE}"; else /usr/local/bin/ts-node --esm "/home/container/${APP_FILE}"; fi

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# NodeJS App Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server
apt update
apt install -y git curl jq file unzip make gcc g++ python3 python3-dev python3-pip libtool

echo -e "updating npm. please wait..."
npm install -g npm@latest ts-node

mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

## add git ending if it's not on the address
if [[ ${GIT_ADDRESS} != *.git ]]; then
    GIT_ADDRESS=${GIT_ADDRESS}.git
fi

if [ -z "${GIT_USERNAME}" ] && [ -z "${GIT_ACCESS_TOKEN}" ]; then
    echo -e "using anon api call"
else
    GIT_ADDRESS="https://${GIT_USERNAME}:${GIT_ACCESS_TOKEN}@$(echo -e ${GIT_ADDRESS} | cut -d/ -f3-)"
fi

## pull git js repo
if [ "$(ls -A /mnt/server)" ]; then
    echo -e "/mnt/server directory is not empty."
    if [ -d .git ]; then
        echo -e ".git directory exists"
        if [ -f .git/config ]; then
            echo -e "loading info from git config"
            ORIGIN=$(git config --get remote.origin.url)
        else
            echo -e "files found with no git config"
            echo -e "closing out without touching things to not break anything"
            exit 10
        fi
    fi

    if [ "${ORIGIN}" == "${GIT_ADDRESS}" ]; then
        echo "pulling latest from github"
        git pull
    fi
else
    echo -e "/mnt/server is empty.\ncloning files into repo"
    if [ -z ${GIT_BRANCH} ]; then
        echo -e "cloning default branch"
        git clone ${GIT_ADDRESS} .
    else
        echo -e "cloning ${GIT_BRANCH}'"
        git clone --single-branch --branch ${GIT_BRANCH} ${GIT_ADDRESS} .
    fi

fi

echo "Installing dependencies from package.json"
if [ -f /mnt/server/package.json ]; then
    /usr/local/bin/npm install --production
fi

echo -e "install complete"
exit 0

variables.name: Main File
variables.description: The main file to run for your application. Can be a .js or .ts file.

variables.name: Reinstall Packages on Start
variables.description: Reinstall packages from package.json on every startup.

variables.name: Git Auto Update
variables.description: Automatically update the application by pulling the latest files from the Git repository on every startup.

variables.name: Git Repository Address
variables.description: The Git repository address to clone from.

variables.name: Git Branch
variables.description: The Git branch to clone from.

variables.name: Git Username
variables.description: The Git username for authentication, if required.

variables.name: Git Access Token
variables.description: The Git access token for authentication, if required.
